etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish نقلاً (naḳlen, “by way of tradition”), from Arabic نَقْلًا (naqlan) adverbial accusative of نَقْل (naql, “transport”), verbal noun of نَقَلَ (naqala, “to transport”). By surface analysis, nakil (“transfer”) + -en. Compare Azerbaijani nəqlən, Crimean Tatar naqlen and Uzbek naqlan.
